pages.home: EthioDirect ‚Äî Coffee That Was Waiting for You
pages.blog_subtitle: Dive into the world of specialty coffee: from Ethiopian plantations to your cup

sidamo_guide.title: Sidamo: Ethiopian Coffee Classic
sidamo_guide.subtitle: The most popular region and its unique terroir
sidamo_guide.intro: If Yirgacheffe is the "pearl" for gourmets, then Sidamo is the "classic" that everyone loves. This large region in southern Ethiopia produces balanced, smooth coffee suitable for any brewing method.
sidamo_guide.geography_p1: Sidamo (or Sidama) is a region in the Rift Valley in southern Ethiopia. Interestingly, Yirgacheffe is technically part of Sidamo but has gained its own status due to its unique flavor.
sidamo_guide.taste_value: milk chocolate, almond, soft citrus acidity
sidamo_guide.why_universal_desc: ‚Äî suitable for both espresso and filter
sidamo_guide.why_balance_desc: ‚Äî not too acidic, not too bitter
sidamo_guide.how_brew_intro: Sidamo is one of the most versatile coffees. It works great with:
sidamo_guide.brew_espresso_desc: ‚Äî medium roast, bright crema, chocolate flavor
sidamo_guide.our_sidamo_text: We work with cooperatives in the Bensa area ‚Äî one of the best sub-regions of Sidamo. Our coffee undergoes washed processing and has a score of 85 SCA points.
sidamo_guide.cta_text: Classic Ethiopian taste in every cup

yirgacheffe_region.title: Yirgacheffe: The Pearl of Ethiopian Coffee
yirgacheffe_region.subtitle: Legendary region with floral taste
yirgacheffe_region.intro: Yirgacheffe is not just a region name, it's a synonym for the most elegant coffee in the world. Floral, citrus notes and incredible cup clarity have made this variety iconic.
yirgacheffe_region.geography_p1: Yirgacheffe is a small district within the Sidamo region in southern Ethiopia. Thanks to its unique microclimate and ideal altitude (1750-2200 m), coffee here acquires a special character.

ethiopia_coffee_origin.title: Ethiopia ‚Äî The Birthplace of Coffee
ethiopia_coffee_origin.subtitle: History, legends and uniqueness
ethiopia_coffee_origin.intro: Ethiopia is the only country where coffee grows naturally in the wild. It was here that coffee was discovered over 1000 years ago thanks to the legendary shepherd Kaldi.
ethiopia_coffee_origin.legend_p1: According to legend, the shepherd Kaldi noticed that his goats became energetic after eating red berries from a certain bush. He told the monks about it, and thus began the history of coffee.
ethiopia_coffee_origin.cta_text: From the birthplace of coffee ‚Äî to your cup

what_is_specialty.title: What is Specialty Coffee and Why Does It Cost More
what_is_specialty.subtitle: Understanding what makes specialty coffee different from regular
what_is_specialty.intro: If you've ever wondered why one bag of coffee costs 100 hryvnias while another costs 400, the answer lies in the concept of specialty coffee.
what_is_specialty.definition: Specialty coffee is coffee that has scored 80 points or higher on the SCA 100-point scale.
what_is_specialty.quote1: Specialty coffee is about 3% of all coffee produced worldwide. It's like comparing table wine to Grand Cru.
what_is_specialty.grading_intro: Coffee grading is a real science. Certified Q-graders analyze beans across 11 criteria.
what_is_specialty.why_expensive_title: Why is Specialty Coffee More Expensive?
what_is_specialty.recognize_title: How to Recognize Real Specialty Coffee
what_is_specialty.cta_title: Ready to Try Real Specialty Coffee?
what_is_specialty.cta_text: Order our bestseller ‚Äî Yirgacheffe with floral and citrus notes

light_vs_dark_roast.title: Light vs Dark Roast
light_vs_dark_roast.subtitle: How roast level affects taste
light_vs_dark_roast.intro: Roasting is the key stage that determines the character of coffee. Light roast reveals terroir and acidity, dark adds body and bitterness.
light_vs_dark_roast.light_desc: Preserves the original bean flavor, emphasizes fruity and floral notes. Ideal for Specialty coffee.
light_vs_dark_roast.dark_desc: Adds caramel, chocolate notes. Less acidity, more bitterness. Classic for espresso.

water_for_coffee.title: Water for Coffee: Complete Guide
water_for_coffee.subtitle: 98% of your cup is water. Here's how to choose it right
water_for_coffee.intro: Coffee is 98% water. Water quality directly affects extraction and taste.

yirgacheffe.title: Yirgacheffe: The Pearl of Ethiopian Coffee
yirgacheffe.subtitle: Why this region produces one of the most expensive coffees in the world
yirgacheffe.intro: If specialty coffee is the best coffee in the world, then Yirgacheffe is the "best of the best". This small region in southern Ethiopia produces coffee that regularly scores 90+ points from the most demanding experts.
yirgacheffe.location_text: Yirgacheffe is a small town and surrounding region in the Gedeo zone, in the Sidamo region (SNNPR) of southern Ethiopia. Altitude ‚Äî 1700-2200 meters above sea level, creating ideal conditions for slow berry ripening.
yirgacheffe.terroir_text: Volcanic soils rich in minerals, even climate with rainy seasons, high altitude ‚Äî all this creates a unique "terroir", similar to famous wine regions.
yirgacheffe.genetics_text: A unique subspecies of Arabica grows here ‚Äî Ethiopian Heirloom. This is not a cultivated variety, but wild varieties that have been preserved for millennia.
yirgacheffe.processing_text: Most Yirgacheffe coffee is processed using the washed method, which emphasizes its clarity and floral notes. Naturally processed is rarer but has an even more intense berry flavor.
yirgacheffe.quote: "Yirgacheffe is not just coffee. It's perfume in a cup. Close your eyes ‚Äî and you're in a flower garden."
yirgacheffe.roast_value: only light or very light medium
yirgacheffe.not_rec_value: Turkish or espresso ‚Äî will overshadow delicate notes
yirgacheffe.our_text: We work directly with a cooperative in the Kochere region (one of the best micro-regions of Yirgacheffe). Our coffee has a score of 88 SCA points and a bright profile: jasmine, bergamot, lemon zest.

ethiopia_origin.title: Ethiopia ‚Äî The Birthplace of Coffee: The Legend of Kaldi
ethiopia_origin.subtitle: The history of coffee discovery over 1000 years ago
ethiopia_origin.intro: Every time you enjoy a cup of coffee, you continue a tradition from the Ethiopian mountains. The legend of the shepherd Kaldi is an integral part of coffee culture.
ethiopia_origin.legend_p1: In the 9th century, goatherd Kaldi noticed: his goats, after eating red berries from an unknown bush, became extremely energetic ‚Äî jumping and unable to sleep.
ethiopia_origin.quote1: "The goats danced in the moonlight. Kaldi understood ‚Äî these berries have magical power."
ethiopia_origin.legend_p2: Kaldi tried the berries himself and felt a surge of energy. He took them to a monastery, where the monks first threw them into the fire. But the incredible aroma of the roasted beans made them reconsider ‚Äî thus the first coffee drink was born.
ethiopia_origin.century16_text: ‚Äî became popular in the Ottoman Empire
ethiopia_origin.century18_text: ‚Äî spread to colonies and became a global commodity
ethiopia_origin.diversity_text: over 10,000 Arabica varieties ‚Äî more than all other countries combined.
ethiopia_origin.traditions_text: most coffee is grown in the shade of natural forest, without chemicals.
ethiopia_origin.quote2: "In Ethiopia they say: 'Buna dabo naw' ‚Äî 'Coffee is our bread'."

light_vs_dark.title: Light or Dark Roast: What to Choose?
light_vs_dark.subtitle: Comparing tastes, caffeine and recommendations
light_vs_dark.intro: One of the most common questions: which roast is better? Answer: it depends on your preferences and brewing method.
light_vs_dark.process_text: Roasting is the thermal processing of green beans at 180-230¬∞C.
light_vs_dark.caffeine_myth_text: Many believe that dark roast is "stronger" and contains more caffeine. This is actually a myth!
light_vs_dark.cta_text: We have coffee from light to dark ‚Äî find yours!

natural_vs_washed.title: Natural vs Washed Coffee Processing
natural_vs_washed.subtitle: How processing method affects taste
natural_vs_washed.intro: The coffee cherry processing method is one of the most important factors determining coffee taste.
natural_vs_washed.natural_text: Cherries are dried whole under the sun for 2-4 weeks. The pulp ferments and imparts sweetness to the bean.
natural_vs_washed.washed_text: Pulp is removed immediately, beans ferment in water. Clean, bright taste.
natural_vs_washed.honey_text: Partial pulp removal. Balance between natural and washed.

grinder_guide.title: How to Choose a Coffee Grinder: Complete Guide
grinder_guide.subtitle: Burr vs blade, manual vs electric
grinder_guide.intro: A grinder is the most important investment after coffee itself. Freshly ground beans unlock the full flavor potential.
grinder_guide.cta_title: Order Coffee for Your New Grinder
